title: PICS: Duchess Kate channelled Princess Diana’s style during Pakistan tour
text:
The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge officially kicked off their five-day tour of Pakistan, and Kate is doing it Princess Diana style.

Earlier this week, the pair touched down in Pakistan, Daily Express reports.

Kate looked regal in a traditional outfit which comprised a flared kurta, which is a long shirt, and matching royal blue trousers.

READ MORE: Kate Middleton fan spends a fortune on copying her looks

Several of the outfits worn by the mother of three were inspired by the shalwar kameez traditional within the region, which include long tunic tops and scarves, quite similar to those once donned by the late Princess of Wales during a tour of Pakistan, Daily Mail reported.

Another outfit similar to that of Princess Di’s was worn during Kate’s visit to Kuala Lumpur, where she donned a white headscarf during their tour of the Assyakirin Mosque, Huffington Post reported.

READ MORE: Meet the women behind duchesses Meghan Markle and Kate Middleton's signature styles

Check out more of the iconic looks below.

Sources: Express UK, Daily Mail, Huffpost
description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge officially kicked off their five-day tour of Pakistan, and Kate is doing it Princess Diana style.
